import Tabs from "@theme/Tabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import CodeSnippet from "@theme/CodeSnippet";

> `<html>` elements must have a `lang` attribute, using a [BCP 47](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tag.
>
> User impact: **Serious**

This rule supports the following configuration:

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# The \`lang\` attribute must be present.\nhtml_has_lang = true\n# The \`lang\` attribute must match the configured language tag.\nhtml_has_lang = "en-US"\n# The \`lang\` attribute must match one of the configured language tags.\nhtml_has_lang = [ "en", "en-US",]`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="toml"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# The \`lang\` attribute must be present.\ncurlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: true' .\n# The \`lang\` attribute must match the configured language tag.\ncurlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: "en-US"' .\n# The \`lang\` attribute must match one of the configured language tags.\ncurlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: ["en", "en-US"]' .`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="shell"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Success

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: Check lang is present -->\n<!-- html_has_lang = true -->\n<html lang="en"></html>\n<!-- Good: Correct language -->\n<!-- html_has_lang = "en" -->\n<html lang="en"></html>\n<!-- Good: Correct language, multiple options -->\n<!-- html_has_lang = [ "en", "en-GB",] -->\n<html lang="en"></html>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: Check lang is present -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: true' . -->\n<html lang="en"></html>\n<!-- Good: Correct language -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: "en"' . -->\n<html lang="en"></html>\n<!-- Good: Correct language, multiple options -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'html_has_lang: ["en", "en-GB"]' . -->\n<html lang="en"></html>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Fail

      annotations={[{"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 3, "code": "html_has_lang", "message": "The `<html>` tag should have a `lang` attribute with a valid value, describing the main language of the page"}, {"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 6, "code": "html_has_lang", "message": "The `<html>` tag should have a `lang` attribute with a valid value, describing the main language of the page.       annotations={[{"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 3, "code": "html_has_lang", "message": "The `<html>` tag should have a `lang` attribute with a valid value, describing the main language of the page"}, {"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 6, "code": "html_has_lang", "message": "The `<html>` tag should have a `lang` attribute with a valid value, describing the main language of the page.
